N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 187.7 - Certificates of completion of work training programs

State Regulations
(a) An organization which has received an
approval of its safety program is authorized to issue a certificate of
completion to a minor who has successfully completed a training program, as
provided by chapter 433 of the Laws of 1971. (b) Such certificate of completion shall
contain the name, address and age of the minor and shall specify the occupation
and work processes for which the minor has completed a work training
program. (c) A certificate of
completion shall authorize the employment of a minor 16 or 17 years of age in
the occupation and in the work processes specified in the certificate of
completion issued by the organization. (d) The employer of the minor shall keep on
file at the place of the minor's employment the certificate of completion so
that it may be readily accessible to any person authorized by law to examine
such document. The employer shall return the certificate to the minor at the
termination of employment. (e) The
certificate of completion shall not excuse noncompliance with the employment
certification requirements of the Labor Law and of the Education Law, nor shall
it excuse noncompliance with any Federal law or regulation. Notes
